rendered_prompt:
Your task is to generate a validation graph using the Shapes Constraint Language (SHACL) based on the description of eligibility requirements for a social benefit. The SHACL graph will be used to validate RDF user data to determine if they are eligible for the benefit. It must therefore always target the node "ff:User".

You will receive:
    - Ontology: Defines the classes, properties, and individuals used in the user RDF graphs.
    - Text: The social benefit description that you must transform into a SHACL graph.

Strictly comply to the following rules:
    - Ensure the output is syntactically valid SHACL.
    - Use only SHACL Core constraint components. 
    - Do not model requirements that cannot be clearly assessed because they are ambiguous or at the discretion of third parties.
    - Do not invent terms outside the ontology.
    - Serialize the shapes graph in Turtle syntax and enclose it within triple backticks, like this: ```turtle ...Turtle content... ```

--- BEGINNING OF ONTOLOGY ---

Text:

Es folgen die Bedingungen für die Sozialleistung 'Gesetzliche Unfallversicherung Waisenrente' mit der IDLB B100019_LB_582435.
Sie erhalten die Waisenrente, wenn die Person infolge eines Versicherungsfalls
gestorben ist. Dazu gehören Arbeitsunfälle, Unfälle auf dem Arbeitsweg und
Berufskrankheiten.

Sie erhalten die Waisenrente als

  * leibliches Kind,
  * Stiefkind oder Pflegekind, wenn Sie im Haushalt der verstorbenen Person gelebt haben und dort versorgt und betreut wurden und als
  * Enkel oder Geschwisterteil, wenn Sie im Haushalt der verstorbenen Person gelebt haben und dort versorgt und betreut wurden.
  * Sie können zudem die Waisenrente erhalten, wenn die verstorbene Person überwiegend für Ihren Lebensunterhalt aufgekommen ist.

Unter diesen Voraussetzungen erhalten Sie die Waisenrente auch dann, wenn Sie
18 bis unter 27 Jahre alt sind:

  * Sie befinden sich in Schul- oder Berufsausbildung oder
  * Sie können wegen einer körperlichen, geistigen oder seelischen Behinderung nicht selbst für Ihren Unterhalt aufkommen oder
  * Sie befinden sich in einer Übergangszeit von höchstens 4 Kalendermonaten 
    * zwischen einem Ausbildungsabschnitt und dem nächsten Ausbildungsabschnitt oder
    * der Ableistung des gesetzlichen Wehr- oder Zivildienstes oder
    * der Ableistung eines freiwilligen Dienstes.

SHACL:
raw_response:
<think>
Okay, so I need to create a SHACL graph based on the given social benefit description. The benefit is the 'Gesetzliche Unfallversicherung Waisenrente' with ID B100019_LB_582435. The target is the ff:User node, and I must ensure the SHACL constraints are correctly applied.

First, I'll read through the eligibility conditions carefully. The user receives the Waisenrente if the person died due to an insured event, which includes work accidents, commuting accidents, or occupational diseases. So, I need to model that the deceased had an event of type WorkAccident, CommutingAccident, or OccupationalDisease.

Next, the user must be a child, stepchild, foster child, grandchild, or sibling of the deceased. I'll use the object property ff:closeRelative to link the user to the deceased. Also, the user must have lived in the same household as the deceased, so I'll use ff:sameHouseholdAs.

The user must be under 18 or satisfy additional conditions if they're between 18 and 27. Those conditions include being in education, having a disability preventing self-support, or being in a transitional period. I'll use the data properties ff:hasAge to check the age and ff:isInTransitionalPeriod for the transitional phase. For education, I'll link to ff:participates with either ff:VocationalTraining or ff:School. For disability, I'll check ff:hasDisability and whether it's severe with ff:severeDisability.

I also need to ensure the deceased was the primary provider, so I'll use ff:hasPrimaryCareTaker pointing to the deceased.

Putting it all together, I'll structure the SHACL shape with each condition as a constraint. I'll make sure each constraint is properly linked and uses the correct properties and classes from the ontology. I'll also ensure that the SHACL syntax is valid and targets the ff:User node as required.
</think>

```turtle
@prefix ff: <https://foerderfunke.org/default#> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .

ff:UserShape
    a sh:Shape ;
    sh:targetClass ff:User ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path [sh:inverse ff:closeRelative] ;
        sh:or (
            [sh:path ff:hasChild]
            [sh:path ff:stepChildTo]
            [sh:path ff:fosterChildTo]
            [sh:path ff:naturalChildTo]
            [sh:path [sh:inverse ff:immediateCircleMember]]
        )
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:sameHouseholdAs ;
        sh:hasValue [sh:inverse ff:deceasedSpouse] ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:hasAge ;
        sh:max 18 ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:isInTransitionalPeriod ;
        sh:max 4 ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:participates ;
        sh:or (
            [sh:path ff:VocationalTraining]
            [sh:path ff:School]
        )
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:hasDisability ;
        sh:equals true ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:severeDisability ;
        sh:equals true ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:hasPrimaryCareTaker ;
        sh:equals [sh:inverse ff:deceasedSpouse]
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path [sh:inverse ff:resultsInTreatment] ;
        sh:or (
            [sh:path ff:WorkAccident]
            [sh:path ff:CommutingAccident]
            [sh:path ff:OccupationalDisease]
        )
    ] .
```

Your task is to generate a validation graph using the Shapes Constraint Language (SHACL) based on the description of eligibility requirements for a social benefit. The SHACL graph will be used to validate RDF user data to determine if they are eligible for the benefit. It must therefore always target the node "ff:User".

You will receive:
    - Ontology: Defines the classes, properties, and individuals used in the user RDF graphs.
    - Text: The social benefit description that you must transform into a SHACL graph.

Strictly comply to the following rules:
    - Ensure the output is syntactically valid SHACL.
    - Use only SHACL Core constraint components. 
    - Do not model requirements that cannot be clearly assessed because they are ambiguous or at the discretion of third parties.
    - Do not invent terms outside the ontology.
    - Serialize the shapes graph in Turtle syntax and enclose it within triple backticks, like this: ```turtle ...Turtle content... ```

Text:

Es folgen die Bedingungen für die Sozialleistung 'Einstiegsgeld' mit der IDLB B100019_LB_102713860.
  * Sie erhalten vor Aufnahme Ihrer neuen Tätigkeit Bürgergeld. Arbeitslosigkeit ist dabei keine Voraussetzung.
  * Sie müssen den Antrag vor der tatsächlichen Aufnahme der Erwerbstätigkeit bei Ihrem Jobcenter stellen.
  * Ihre neue Selbstständigkeit oder Ihre neue Beschäftigung ist geeignet, dass Sie perspektivisch Ihre Hilfebedürftigkeit überwinden.
  * Das Einstiegsgeld ist für Ihre Eingliederung in den allgemeinen Arbeitsmarkt erforderlich.
  * Ihre Erwerbstätigkeit umfasst mindestens 15 Stunden pro Woche.

Zusätzliche Voraussetzungen bei Selbständigkeit/ Existenzgründung:

  * Positive Bewertung des Jobcenters über 
    * Ihre persönliche Eignung,
    * die wirtschaftliche Tragfähigkeit Ihrer selbständigen Tätigkeit

SHACL:
raw_response:
<think>
Alright, I'm trying to help the user by generating a SHACL graph based on the given eligibility requirements for the social benefit 'Einstiegsgeld'. The user has provided the ontology and the text describing the requirements, so I need to transform that text into a valid SHACL graph.

First, I'll start by understanding the requirements. The benefit is for individuals who are about to start a new job or become self-employed and are currently receiving 'Bürgergeld' (citizen benefit). They must apply before starting their new employment, and the new job must have at least 15 hours of work per week. Additionally, for self-employment, the job center must positively assess the applicant's personal suitability and the economic viability of their business.

Now, I need to map these requirements to the provided ontology. The SHACL graph must target the node 'ff:User', so I'll create a shape for that. 

1. **Receiving Bürgergeld**: The user must receive 'Bürgergeld', which is represented by 'ff:receivesBenefit' with the value 'ff:B100019_LB_576986'. So, I'll add a property 'ff:receivesBenefit' with 'exactly one' constraint pointing to that individual.

2. **Application Before Employment**: The application must be submitted before starting the new job. This can be checked using a SPARQL query that ensures the application date is before the employment start date. I'll use 'sh:property' with 'sh:path' as 'ff:hasEvent' and a constraint using a SPARQL expression.

3. **New Employment Exists**: The user must have a new employment. I'll use 'ff:hasEmployment' with 'exactly one' constraint.

4. **Employment Hours >=15**: The employment must be at least 15 hours a week. Using 'ff:workHoursPerWeek' with a minimum value of 15.

5. **Positive Job Center Assessment for Self-Employment**: If the user is self-employed, the job center must approve both personal suitability and economic viability. This requires a SPARQL query that checks for the existence of these assessments.

Putting this all together, I'll structure the SHACL graph with each condition as a separate property constraint under the 'ff:User' shape. Each constraint will use the appropriate SHACL components and reference the correct ontology terms.

I need to ensure that the SHACL syntax is correct and that I'm only using SHACL Core components without any extensions. I also must avoid adding any terms not present in the provided ontology. The final graph should be in Turtle syntax, properly formatted and enclosed within triple backticks as per the user's instructions.
</think>

```turtle
@prefix ff: <https://foerderfunke.org/default#> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .

ff:UserShape
    a sh:Shape ;
    sh:targetClass ff:User ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:receivesBenefit ;
        sh:hasValue ff:B100019_LB_576986 ;
        sh:minCount 1 ;
        sh:maxCount 1 ;
    ] , [
        sh:path [ sh:property ff:hasEvent sh:zeroOrMore ] ;
        sh:constraint [
            sh:property [ sh:path ff:hasDate ] ;
            sh:maxCount 1 ;
            sh:lessThan [
                sh:property [ sh:path ff:hasEmployment sh:property (ff:hasEvent sh:zeroOrMore) sh:property ff:hasDate ] ;
                sh:maxCount 1 ;
            ] ;
        ] ;
    ] , [
        sh:path ff:hasEmployment ;
        sh:minCount 1 ;
    ] , [
        sh:path [ sh:property ff:hasEmployment sh:property ff:workHoursPerWeek ] ;
        sh:minValue 15 ;
    ] , [
        sh:path [ sh:property ff:hasEmployment sh:property (ff:isSelfEmployed sh:zeroOrMore) sh:property ff:recognizedByLaw ] ;
        sh:constraint [
            sh:property [ sh:path ff:recognizedByLaw ] ;
            sh:hasValue ff:FederalEmploymentAgency ;
            sh:minCount 1 ;
        ] ;
        sh:constraint [
            sh:property [ sh:path (ff:recognizedByLaw sh:zeroOrMore) sh:property ff:workforceIntegrationProblemBecause ] ;
            sh:minCount 1 ;
        ] ;
    ] .
```

The SHACL graph will be used to validate RDF user data to determine if they are eligible for the benefit. It must therefore always target the node "ff:User".

You will receive:
    - Ontology: Defines the classes, properties, and individuals used in the user RDF graphs.
    - Text: The social benefit description that you must transform into a SHACL graph.

Strictly comply to the following rules:
    - Ensure the output is syntactically valid SHACL.
    - Use only SHACL Core constraint components. 
    - Do not model requirements that cannot be clearly assessed because they are ambiguous or at the discretion of third parties.

Text:

Es folgen die Bedingungen für die Sozialleistung 'Kinderzuschlag' mit der IDLB B100019_LB_581863.
Um einen Kinderzuschlag zu bekommen, müssen folgende Voraussetzungen erfüllt
sein:

  * Ihr Kind/Ihre Kinder ist/sind jünger als 25 Jahre, nicht verheiratet oder verpartnert und lebt/leben in Ihrem Haushalt.
  * Sie beziehen für Ihr Kind/Ihre Kinder Kindergeld oder eine vergleichbare Leistung zum Beispiel aus dem Ausland.
  * Sie verfügen 
    * als Paar gemeinsam über ein Bruttoeinkommen von mindestens 900,00 EUR im Monat (ohne Wohngeld, Kindergeld und Kinderzuschlag) oder
    * als alleinerziehende Person über mindestens 600,00 EUR im Monat.
  * Ihr Einkommen, das auf den Kinderzuschlag angerechnet wird, ist nicht so hoch, dass sich der Kinderzuschlag auf null reduziert.
  * Sie verfügen über kein erhebliches Vermögen.
  * Den Kinderzuschlag können Sie in der Regel erhalten, wenn Sie mit Ihrem Einkommen, dem Kindergeld, dem eventuell zustehendem Wohngeld und dem Kinderzuschlag den Bedarf der ganzen Familie im Sinne des SGB II decken können.
  * Kinderzuschlag ist nachrangig gegenüber anderen möglichen Einkünften des Kindes; gegebenenfalls besteht die Verpflichtung, sich um vorrangige Ansprüche wie Unterhalt oder Unterhaltsvorschuss zu bemühen.

SHACL:
raw_response:
<think>
Okay, I need to create a SHACL graph to validate user data for the 'Kinderzuschlag' benefit. Let me start by understanding the eligibility requirements.

First, the user must have a child under 25 who isn't married or in a civil partnership and lives in the same household. So, I'll need to check if the user has a child (using ff:hasChild) whose age is less than 25, marital status is not married or in a civil union, and they live together.

Next, the user must receive child benefit or a similar payment. I'll use ff:receivesBenefit with the specific benefit ID for child allowance.

Then, there are income conditions. Couples need a combined gross income of at least €900/month, and single parents at least €600/month. I'll check the user's income and whether they're a single parent.

The income used for the allowance shouldn't reduce it to zero, so I'll ensure the calculated amount isn't zero.

The user must not have significant assets, so I'll check the data property ff:hasConsiderableAssets is false.

They must be able to cover their family's basic needs with their income and benefits. I'll use ff:canCoverBasicNeedsOfBenefitUnit.

Lastly, the benefit is secondary to other possible income, so the user shouldn't be eligible for other benefits that take priority. I'll use ff:hasNoPriorityClaimsOver with the specific benefit ID.

I'll structure these conditions using SHACL shapes, ensuring each condition is a separate shape and all are part of the main shape targeting ff:User.
</think>

```turtle
@prefix ff: <https://foerderfunke.org/default#> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .

ff:KinderzuschlagShape a sh:NodeShape ;
    sh:targetClass ff:User ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:hasChild ;
        sh:minCount 1 ;
        sh:nodeKind sh:BlankNode ;
        sh:property [
            sh:path ff:hasAge ;
            sh:max 24 ;
            sh:datatype xsd:int ;
        ] ;
        sh:property [
            sh:path ff:hasMaritalStatus ;
            sh:equals ff:Unmarried ;
        ] ;
        sh:property [
            sh:path ff:sameHouseholdAs ;
            sh:equals ff:User ;
        ] ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:receivesBenefit ;
        sh:hasValue ff:B100019_LB_576986 ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:personalGrossIncome ;
        sh:minValue 600 ;
        sh:condition [
            sh:path ff:isSingleParent ;
            sh:equals true ;
        ] ;
        sh:datatype xsd:int ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:familyGrossIncome ;
        sh:minValue 900 ;
        sh:condition [
            sh:path ff:isSingleParent ;
            sh:equals false ;
        ] ;
        sh:datatype xsd:int ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:hasConsiderableAssets ;
        sh:equals false ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:canCoverBasicNeedsOfBenefitUnit ;
        sh:equals true ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:hasNoPriorityClaimsOver ;
        sh:hasValue ff:B100019_LB_581863 ;
    ] .
```

rendered_prompt:
Your task is to generate a validation graph using the Shapes Constraint Language (SHACL) based on the description of eligibility requirements for a social benefit. The SHACL graph will be used to validate RDF user data to determine if they are eligible for the benefit. It must therefore always target the node "ff:User".

You will receive:
    - Ontology: Defines the classes, properties, and individuals used in the user RDF graphs.
    - Text: The social benefit description that you must transform into a SHACL graph.

Strictly comply to the following rules:
    - Ensure the output is syntactically valid SHACL.
    - Use only SHACL Core constraint components. 
    - Do not model requirements that cannot be clearly assessed because they are ambiguous or at the discretion of third parties.
    - Do not invent terms outside the ontology.
    - Serialize the shapes graph in Turtle syntax and enclose it within triple backticks, like this: ```turtle ...Turtle content... ```

Text:

Es folgen die Bedingungen für die Sozialleistung 'Bürgergeld' mit der IDLB B100019_LB_106311931.
  * Sie sind erwerbsfähig. Das heißt, dass Sie 
    * mindestens 3 Stunden täglich arbeiten können und
    * mindestens 15 Jahre alt sind und die Altersgrenze der gesetzlichen Rentenversicherung noch nicht erreicht haben. Wenn Sie nach 1963 geboren sind, liegt diese bei 67 Jahren. Sind Sie vor 1964 geboren, können Sie die für Sie geltende Altersgrenze in der Tabelle in § 7a Sozialgesetzbuch II (SGB II) nachschauen.
  * Sie sind hilfebedürftig. Das heißt, dass Sie Ihren eigenen notwendigen Lebensunterhalt und den Lebensunterhalt der mit Ihnen in einer Bedarfsgemeinschaft lebenden, nicht erwerbsfähigen Angehörigen weder aus eigenen Mitteln (Einkommen und Vermögen) und Kräften (Einsatz der Arbeitskraft) noch mithilfe anderer beziehungsweise vorrangiger Leistungen (zum Beispiel Arbeitslosengeld, Wohngeld, Kinderzuschlag) bestreiten können.
  * Sie haben keine vorrangigen Ansprüche gegenüber anderen Leistungsträgern (zum Beispiel Wohngeld) oder anderen Personen, wie beispielsweise gegen geschiedene Ehepartner oder den Vater oder die Mutter Ihres Kindes.
  * Sie leben in der Bundesrepublik Deutschland.

SHACL:
raw_response:
<think>
Okay, I need to create a SHACL graph to validate eligibility for the 'Bürgergeld' benefit based on the given text. Let me go through the requirements step by step.

First, the user must be erwerbsfähig, which means they're capable of working. The SHACL graph needs to ensure that the user has an EarningCapacity. I'll use ff:hasEarningCapacity as the property and set the shape to ensure it's present.

Next, the user must be able to work at least 3 hours a day. The ontology has ff:employableHoursPerDay, which is a data property. I'll add a constraint that this value is at least 3.

They also need to be at least 15 years old. The ontology has ff:hasAge, so I'll set a minimum of 15 using sh:minInclusive.

The user shouldn't have reached the pension age. For people born after 1963, it's 67, and earlier births have different limits. Since the ontology doesn't have a specific property for birth year, I'll assume the age limit is 67 and set a maximum age using ff:hasAge with sh:maxExclusive.

The user must be help-seeking, meaning they can't cover their basic needs. The ontology has ff:canCoverPersonalBasicNeeds, which is a boolean. I'll set this to false using sh:equals.

They must live in Germany. The property ff:countryOfResidence with value ff:Germany will handle this.

There should be no prior claims against others. The property ff:hasNoPriorityClaimsOver should exist, indicating no higher-priority benefits.

Putting it all together, I'll define a shape for ff:User with these constraints using the appropriate SHACL properties and values from the ontology.
</think>

```turtle
@prefix ff: <https://foerderfunke.org/default#> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .

ff:BürgergeldEligibilityShape
  a sh:Shape ;
  sh:targetClass ff:User ;
  sh:property [
      sh:path ff:hasEarningCapacity ;
      sh:minCount 1 ;
    ] , [
      sh:path ff:employableHoursPerDay ;
      sh:minInclusive 3 ;
    ] , [
      sh:path ff:hasAge ;
      sh:minInclusive 15 ;
      sh:maxExclusive 67 ;
    ] , [
      sh:path ff:canCoverPersonalBasicNeeds ;
      sh:equals false ;
    ] , [
      sh:path ff:countryOfResidence ;
      sh:equals ff:Germany ;
    ] , [
      sh:path ff:hasNoPriorityClaimsOver ;
      sh:minCount 1 ;
    ] .
```

rendered_prompt:
Your task is to generate a validation graph using the Shapes Constraint Language (SHACL) based on the description of eligibility requirements for a social benefit. The SHACL graph will be used to validate RDF user data to determine if they are eligible for the benefit. It must therefore always target the node "ff:User".

You will receive:
    - Ontology: Defines the classes, properties, and individuals used in the user RDF graphs.
    - Text: The social benefit description that you must transform into a SHACL graph.

Strictly comply to the following rules:
    - Ensure the output is syntactically valid SHACL.
    - Use only SHACL Core constraint components. 
    - Do not model requirements that cannot be clearly assessed because they are ambiguous or at the discretion of third parties.
    - Do not invent terms outside the ontology.
    - Serialize the shapes graph in Turtle syntax and enclose it within triple backticks, like this: ```turtle ...Turtle content... ```

ObjectProperty: ff:atRiskOfDisabilityType
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a particular type of disability that they risk developing."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Disability 

ObjectProperty: ff:cannotSupportThemselvesBecause
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Points to a reason (e.g., Disability) why a person cannot support themselves."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Disability 

ObjectProperty: ff:caregiverInHousehold
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a care need to a person who can provide the care and lives in the same household as the person who needs care."@en
    Domain: ff:CareNeed
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:causeOfDeath
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to an event that  caused their death."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Event 

ObjectProperty: ff:closeRelative
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to another person who is a close relative."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:countryOfEmployment
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Defines the country where an employment takes place."@en
    Domain: ff:Employment
    Range: ff:Country 

ObjectProperty: ff:countryOfResidence
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to their country of residence."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Country 

ObjectProperty: ff:deceasedCivilPartner
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to another person who deceased as their civil partner."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:deceasedSpouse
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person who deceased as their spouse."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:derivesFreedomOfMovementFrom
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to another person from whom they derive freedom of movement under the Freedom of Movement Act."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:employer
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a person or organization that employs them."@en
    Domain: ff:Employment
    Range: ff:Employer 

ObjectProperty: ff:fosterChildTo
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to their foster parent."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasChild
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to their child."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasDisabilityType
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a particular type of disability that they have."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Disability 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasEarningCapacity
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to the status of their earning capacity."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:EarningCapacity 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasEmployment
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a user to a current employment."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Employment 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasEmploymentStatus
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to their legal employment status."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:EmploymentStatus 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasEvent
    Domain: ff:Employer,
        ff:Person
    Range: ff:Event 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasIncome
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to an object describing their income."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Income 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasInsurance
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to an insurance that they have."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Insurance 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasMaritalStatus
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to their legal marital status."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:MaritalStatus 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasNoPriorityClaimsOver
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a social benefit if they are not eligible for other benefits with priority over this one."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:SocialBenefit 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasPrimaryCareTaker
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a person who has the main responsibility for their living expenses."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasRehabilitationProvider
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to their rehabilitation provider."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:RehabilitationProvider 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasResidencePermit
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a residence permit that they hold."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:ResidencePermit 

ObjectProperty: ff:hasResidenceStatus
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to their residence status in Germany."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:ResidenceStatus 

ObjectProperty: ff:immediateCircleMember
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to another person who is a member of their immediate circle."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:incomeTaxCountry
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to the country where they are subject to income tax."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Country 

ObjectProperty: ff:incomeTaxLiability
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to the scope of their income tax liability."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:TaxLiabilityScope 

ObjectProperty: ff:intendedFundingPeriod
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links something (e.g., a training) to the intended funding period."@en
    Domain: ff:Training
    Range: ff:Duration 

ObjectProperty: ff:isEligibleFor
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a service for which they are eligible."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:SocialBenefit 

ObjectProperty: ff:isIneligibleFor
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a service for which they are ineligible."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:SocialBenefit 

ObjectProperty: ff:isNationalOf
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a country where they are a national."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Country 

ObjectProperty: ff:legalUnionBeforeEvent
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links an event (e.g., insurance event), experienced by person A, to another person B with whom they were married or in a civil union before and during the event."@en
    Domain: ff:Event
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:naturalChildTo
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to their natural parent."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:needsCare
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person who needs care to a node describing their care needs."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:CareNeed 

ObjectProperty: ff:parentalAdress
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to the adress of one or more parents."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Adress 

ObjectProperty: ff:participates
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a program, e.g. a formal training, in which they are currently participating."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Training 

ObjectProperty: ff:receivedBenefit
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a benefit that they have received in the past."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:SocialBenefit 

ObjectProperty: ff:receivesBenefit
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a social benefit that they are currently receiving."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:SocialBenefit 

ObjectProperty: ff:receivesChildBenefitFor
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a child for which they receive child benefit."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:recognizedByLaw
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links something to a law under which it is officially recoginzed."@en
    Domain: ff:Training
    Range: ff:LegalCode 

ObjectProperty: ff:resultsInTreatment
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Describes an event that results in medical treatment."@en
    Domain: ff:Event
    Range: ff:OccupationalRehabilitation 

ObjectProperty: ff:ruleExemptionBecause
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links something to a reason why it is exempted from a certain rule."@en
    Domain: ff:Training
    Range: ff:Disability 

ObjectProperty: ff:sameHouseholdAs
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links two persons who live in the same household."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:socialSecurityCountry
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to the country where they are subject to social security."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Country 

ObjectProperty: ff:socialSecurityDuration
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a node describing the duration of their social security obligations."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Duration 

ObjectProperty: ff:stepChildTo
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to their step parent."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Person 

ObjectProperty: ff:subjectToContract
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links something to a type of contract to which it is subject."@en
    Domain: ff:Training
    Range: ff:VocationalTrainingContract 

ObjectProperty: ff:triggeringEvent
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links something (e.g., earning capacity) to an event that caused it."@en
    Domain: ff:EarningCapacity,
        ff:OccupationalRehabilitation
    Range: ff:Event 

ObjectProperty: ff:wasEligibleFor
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to a benefit for which they have been eligible in the past."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:SocialBenefit 

ObjectProperty: ff:wasEntitledToCashBenefitBefore
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to an event before which they were entitled to a cash benefit like salary or unemployment benefit."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Event 

ObjectProperty: ff:workforceIntegrationProblemBecause
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Points to a reason (e.g., Disabiltiy) why a person needs support with their integration into the workforce."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: ff:Disability 

DataProperty: ff:aboveSGBXII41AgeLimit
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person has reached the age limit under § 41 SGB XII, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:adequateHealthInsurance
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person has adequate health insurance cover under the Freedom of Movement Act, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:availableForPlacement
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person is able and willing to work subject to compulsory insurance under normal labor market conditions, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:canCoverBasicNeedsOfBenefitUnit
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person can cover the basic needs of themselves and the unemployed individuals in their benefit unit with their income, assets, and priority benefits, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:canCoverPersonalBasicNeeds
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person can cover their personal basic needs with their income, assets, and priority benefits, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:causesLossOfEarnings
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if an event causes a loss of earnings for the person experiencing it, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Event
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:commissionedByEmploymentAgency
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a given training was commissioned by the employment agency, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Training
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:compulsoryInsuranceFor12In30
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person has been subject to compulsory insurance for at least 12 months within the last 30 months before registering as unemployed, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:eligibleWithinLast3Years
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person was eligible for a social benefit within the last 3 years."@en
    Domain: ff:SocialBenefit
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:employableHoursPerDay
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to the hours they are able to work per day."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:decimal 

DataProperty: ff:entitledToAsylum
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person is entitled to asylum, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:entitlesToEmployment
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a permit entitles to employment, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:ResidencePermit
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:familyGrossIncome
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Points to the amount of family gross income."@en
    Domain: ff:Income
    Range: xsd:decimal 

DataProperty: ff:fullDayAccompaniment
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "A medical accompaniement takes more than 8 hours, including time at the hospital and travel to and from the hospital."@en
    Domain: ff:MedicalAccompaniment
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:hasAge
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to their age in completed years."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:int 

DataProperty: ff:hasAsylumActPermit
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person has a residence permit under the Asylum Act, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:hasConsiderableAssets
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person has considerable assets under the German Social Code, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:hasDate
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links an event to the date when it took place."@en
    Domain: ff:Event
    Range: xsd:dateTime 

DataProperty: ff:hasDisability
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person has a disability, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:inEmployment
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person is currently in an employment relationship, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:inPatientCoAdmission
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person is admitted as accompanying person for inpatient treatment, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:MedicalAccompaniment
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:isFirstVocationalTraining
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a training instance is a person's first vocational training, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Training
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:isInTransitionalPeriod
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person is in a transitional period of 4 calendar months or less between between two formal educations or after the completion of compulsory military service / community service / voluntary service. False otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:isOpen
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a proceeding is open, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:InsolvencyProceeding
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:isPensionable
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True, if a person has reached the legal retirement age, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:isPermanent
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a given condition (e.g., earning capacity) is permanent, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:EarningCapacity
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:isRenumerated
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person is renumerated for an event, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Event
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:isSingleParent
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person is a single parent, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:isVocationalReturnee
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person is a vocational returnee, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:lessThanFourMonthsAgo
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if an event happened less than four months ago, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Event
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:monthsAbroad
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links something with a duration (e.g., a training) to the time that it takes place abroad in complete months."@en
    Domain: ff:Training
    Range: xsd:int 

DataProperty: ff:monthsTotal
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "The total duration of something in completed months."@en
    Domain: ff:Duration
    Range: xsd:int 

DataProperty: ff:monthsWithinLast3Years
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "The duration of something within the last three years in compelted months."@en
    Domain: ff:Duration
    Range: xsd:int 

DataProperty: ff:newUnionAfterWidowhood
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a widowed person remarried or entered a new civil union."@en
    Domain: ff:MaritalStatus
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:obviousLackOfAssets
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if an event coincides with an obvious lack of assets of the thing experiencing the event."@en
    Domain: ff:Employer
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:percentAbroad
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links something with a duration (e.g., a training) to the time that it takes place abroad in percentage."@en
    Domain: ff:Duration,
        ff:Training
    Range: xsd:decimal 

DataProperty: ff:permanentRightOfResidence
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person has acquired a permanent right of residence under the Freedom of Movement Act, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:personalGrossIncome
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Points to the amount of personal gross income."@en
    Domain: ff:Income
    Range: xsd:int 

DataProperty: ff:receivedWithinLast3Years
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person received a benefit within the last 3 years."@en
    Domain: ff:SocialBenefit
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:recognizedRefugee
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person is a legally recognized refugee, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:reducesChildSupplementTo
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "An applicant's income is offset against child supplement to varying degrees. This property links an income to the amount of child supplement remaining after any income-related reductions are taken into account."@en
    Domain: ff:Income
    Range: xsd:decimal 

DataProperty: ff:reducesWorkProspectsPermanently
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a disability reduces a person's prospect of participating in working life permanently."@en
    Domain: ff:Disability
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:reductionDurationInWeeks
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Points to the duration in completed weeks for which something (e.g., earning capacity) has been reduced."@en
    Domain: ff:EarningCapacity
    Range: xsd:int 

DataProperty: ff:reductionInPercent
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Points to the percentage by which something (e.g. earning capacity) is reduced."@en
    Domain: ff:EarningCapacity
    Range: xsd:decimal 

DataProperty: ff:rejectedForLackOfAssets
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if an insolvency application was rejected for lack of assets, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:InsolvencyApplication
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:severeDisability
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a disability is severe, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Disability
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:sufficientMeansOfSubsistence
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person has sufficient means of subsistence under the Freedom of Movement Act, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:tooFarFromTrainingCompany
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if an adress is too far from the user's training company to stay there during training, false otherwise."@en
    Domain: ff:Adress
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:unfitForWork
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a person is unfit for gainful employment, false otherwise."@en, rdfs:label "arbeitsunfähig"@de
    Domain: ff:EarningCapacity
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:uninterruptedLegalStayForLessThan15Months
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "True if a non-German nationa has been in Germany for less than 15 months without interruption on a permitted, authorized or tolerated basis."@en
    Domain: ff:Person
    Range: xsd:boolean 

DataProperty: ff:wageCutOffsetMonths
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links an event to the number of full months within which a wage cut occurred relative to the date of the event. Negative (resp. positive) values indicate a wage cut before (resp. after) the event."@en
    Domain: ff:Event
    Range: xsd:int 

DataProperty: ff:workHoursPerWeek
    Annotations: rdfs:comment "Links a person to the fractional hours they are working on a job per week."@en
    Domain: ff:Employment
    Range: xsd:decimal

Text:

Es folgen die Bedingungen für die Sozialleistung 'Berufsausbildungsbeihilfe' mit der IDLB B100019_LB_574724.
Damit Sie die Berufsausbildungsbeihilfe bekommen können, müssen Sie und Ihre
Berufsausbildung förderfähig sein.

Förderungsberechtigter Personenkreis:

  * Sie wohnen während der Ausbildung nicht bei Ihren Eltern und der Ausbildungsbetrieb ist vom Elternhaus zu weit entfernt oder Sie 
    * sind mindestens 18 Jahre alt oder
    * sind oder waren verheiratet oder
    * haben mindestens ein Kind, das bei Ihnen wohnt.
  * Auch wenn Sie nicht Deutscher sind, haben Sie grundsätzlich einen Anspruch auf Berufsausbildungsbeihilfe, es sei denn 
    * Sie haben eine Aufenthaltsgestattung nach dem Asylgesetz.
    * Sie sind geduldet und halten sich seit weniger als 15 Monaten ununterbrochen erlaubt, gestattet oder geduldet in Deutschland auf.
  * Sie können nicht die erforderlichen Mittel aufbringen, um folgende Kosten zu decken: 
    * Kosten für den Lebensunterhalt
    * Fahrtkosten zwischen Unterkunft und Ausbildungsstätte oder Berufsschule
    * Familienheimfahrten
    * Arbeitskleidung
    * Kinderbetreuungskosten

Förderungsfähige Berufsausbildung:

  * Es ist Ihre erste Berufsausbildung oder
  * wenn es nicht Ihre erste Berufsausbildung ist: Sie können nicht auf eine andere Weise dauerhaft beruflich eingegliedert werden.
  * Sie machen eine Berufsausbildung. 
    * die nach dem Berufsbildungsgesetz, der Handwerksordnung oder dem Seearbeitsgesetz anerkannt ist
    * oder eine Berufsausbildung nach Teil 2 des Pflegeberufegesetzes.
  * Sie schließen einen Berufsausbildungsvertrag ab.

Wenn Sie eine Behinderung haben, können Sie Berufsausbildungsbeihilfe auch
bekommen, wenn

  * Sie eine Berufsausbildung machen, die abweichend von den Ausbildungsordnungen für staatlich anerkannte Ausbildungsberufe oder in Sonderformen für behinderte Menschen durchgeführt wird,
  * Sie Ihre Ausbildung verlängern müssen,
  * Sie die Ausbildung aufgrund Ihrer Behinderung ganz oder teilweise wiederholen und eine dauerhafte Teilhabe am Arbeitsleben sonst nicht möglich wäre oder
  * Sie im Haushalt der Eltern oder eines Elternteils wohnen.

Zusätzliche Voraussetzung bei berufsvorbereitenden Bildungsmaßnahmen:

  * Die berufsvorbereitende Bildungsmaßnahme wird im Auftrag der Agentur für Arbeit durchgeführt

Eine Ausbildung oder berufsvorbereitende Bildungsmaßnahme im Ausland ist wie
folgt förderfähig:

  * bei teilweiser Ausbildung im Ausland, wenn 
    * der Teil der Ausbildung im Ausland nicht länger als 1 Jahr dauert und
    * der Teil der Ausbildung im Ausland im Hinblick auf die Gesamtdauer der Ausbildung als angemessen erscheint
  * bei vollständiger Ausbildung im Ausland, 
    * wenn die Ausbildung im Ausland dem Berufsziel des Antragstellers besonders dienlich ist und
    * amtlich bestätigt wird, dass die Ausbildung im Ausland einer betrieblichen Ausbildung in Deutschland gleichgestellt ist
  * bei teilweise im Ausland stattfindender berufsvorbereitender Bildungsmaßname, wenn 
    * der Teil im Ausland die Hälfte der vorgesehenen Förderdauer nicht übersteigt und
    * der Teil im Ausland im Hinblick auf die Gesamtdauer der Maßnahme als angemessen erscheint.

<think>
Okay, so I need to create a SHACL graph based on the eligibility requirements for the 'Berufsausbildungsbeihilfe' benefit. The target is always the node "ff:User". Let me go through the text step by step and map the conditions to SHACL constraints.

First, the benefit is for users who are 18 or older, married, divorced, widowed, or have a child living with them. They must not be living with their parents, and the training location should be too far from their parents' home. So, I'll create a shape for ff:User with these conditions. I'll use sh:or to combine these options because the user needs to meet at least one.

Next, non-Germans can apply unless they have an asylum seeker status or have been in Germany for less than 15 months. I'll add a constraint that the user's residence status is not ff:AsylumSeekerBenefits and they've been in Germany for more than 15 months without interruption.

The user must not have enough means to cover living costs, travel, family visits, work clothes, and childcare. I'll express this with ff:canCoverPersonalBasicNeeds set to false.

For the training to be eligible, it must be their first vocational training or they can't integrate into the workforce otherwise. I'll use ff:isFirstVocationalTraining and sh:or with ff:isVocationalReturnee. The training should be recognized under specific laws, so I'll include ff:recognizedByLaw with the appropriate legal codes.

If the user has a disability, additional conditions apply, such as special training formats or living with parents. I'll create a separate shape for ff:Disability linked through ff:hasDisabilityType.

Lastly, the training must be in Germany or meet specific criteria if abroad. I'll use ff:countryOfEmployment to check if it's in Germany and handle exceptions for partial or full foreign training with the relevant constraints.

I need to ensure all terms are from the provided ontology and use only SHACL Core components. I'll structure each condition as a separate shape and combine them using sh:and and sh:or as needed.
</think>

```turtle
@prefix ff: <https://foerderfunke.org/default#> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .

ff:UserShape a sh:NodeShape ;
    sh:targetClass ff:User ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path [ sh:inverse ff:isEligibleFor ] ;
        sh:minCount 1 ;
        sh:hasValue ff:B100019_LB_574724 ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:hasAge ;
        sh:min 18 ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:isSingleParent ;
        sh:hasValue "true"^^xsd:boolean ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:hasMaritalStatus ;
        sh:in ( ff:Married ff:Divorced ff:Widowed ) ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:hasChild ;
        sh:minCount 1 ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:sameHouseholdAs ;
        sh:maxCount 0 ;
        sh:qualifiedValueShape [
            sh:path ff:naturalChildTo ;
            sh:hasValue ff:UserShape ;
        ]
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:countryOfResidence ;
        sh:equals ff:Germany ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:hasResidenceStatus ;
        sh:in ( ff:Tolerated ) ;
        sh:maxCount 0 ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:uninterruptedLegalStayForLessThan15Months ;
        sh:hasValue "false"^^xsd:boolean ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:canCoverPersonalBasicNeeds ;
        sh:hasValue "false"^^xsd:boolean ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:participates ;
        sh:nodeKind sh:Literal ;
        sh:datatype xsd:boolean ;
        sh:hasValue "true" ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:hasEarningCapacity ;
        sh:node ff:FullEarningCapacity ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:isFirstVocationalTraining ;
        sh:hasValue "true" ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:recognizedByLaw ;
        sh:in ( ff:Berufsbildungsgesetz ff:Handwerksordnung ff:Seearbeitsgesetz ff:Pflegeberufegesetz ) ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:subjectToContract ;
        sh:node ff:VocationalTrainingContract ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:countryOfEmployment ;
        sh:equals ff:Germany ;
    ] ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:hasDisability ;
        sh:or (
            [ sh:path ff:needsCare ; sh:minCount 1 ]
            [ sh:path ff:hasDisabilityType ; sh:node ff:SevereDisability ]
        ) ;
    ] .

The SHACL graph will be used to validate RDF user data to determine if they are eligible for the benefit. It must therefore always target the node "ff:User".

You will receive:
    - Ontology: Defines the classes, properties, and individuals used in the user RDF graphs.

Strictly comply to the following rules:

Text:

Es folgen die Bedingungen für die Sozialleistung 'Kindergeld' mit der IDLB B100019_LB_576986.
Voraussetzungen, die für Sie als Eltern gelten:

  * Sie sind in Deutschland unbeschränkt einkommensteuerpflichtig oder werden so veranlagt. Dies gilt auch für Staatangehörige der EU, des EWR oder der Schweiz. Ein inländischer Wohnsitz ist nicht zwingend erforderlich.
  * Für Staatsangehörige der EU oder des EWR, die ab August 2019 nach Deutschland ziehen, gelten weitere Voraussetzungen. Ab dem 4. Monat ab Einreise müssen die Voraussetzungen des Freizügigkeitsgesetzes erfüllt sein. Unionsbürgerinnen und Unionsbürger sind freizügigkeitsberechtigt, wenn sie 
    * selbständig oder unselbständig erwerbstätig sind
    * arbeitsuchend oder unfreiwillig arbeitslos sind
    * ihr Freizügigkeitsrecht von einem Familienangehörigen ableiten können
    * über ausreichende Existenzmittel und ausreichenden Krankenversicherungsschutz verfügen oder
    * ein Daueraufenthaltsrecht erworben haben.

  * Sie sind zwar nicht Staatsbürgerin oder Staatsbürger der EU, des EWR oder der Schweiz, aber besitzen eine gültige Niederlassungserlaubnis oder einen bestimmten anderen Aufenthaltstitel, der zur Ausübung einer Erwerbstätigkeit berechtigt oder
  * Sie sind rechtskräftig anerkannter Flüchtling oder asylberechtigt.

Voraussetzungen, die für Ihr Kind gelten:

  * Ihr Kind muss seinen Wohnsitz oder gewöhnlichen Aufenthalt in Deutschland oder in einem anderen EU beziehungsweise EWR-Staat oder der Schweiz haben.
  * Eventuell haben Sie auch dann Anspruch auf Kindergeld, wenn Ihr Kind zwar in einem Haushalt in der EU, der EWR oder der Schweiz lebt, beispielsweise Sie oder der andere Elternteil aber in Deutschland unbeschränkt einkommensteuerpflichtig ist oder so veranlagt wird.

Okay, I need to create a SHACL graph to validate eligibility for the 'Kindergeld' social benefit based on the provided text and ontology. Let's break down the requirements step by step.

First, the target is always the node "ff:User". So, I'll start by creating a shape for ff:User.

Looking at the text, the eligibility conditions for parents and children are outlined. I'll separate these into two main sections: parent conditions and child conditions.

For the parents:

1. The user must have unlimited tax liability in Germany. In the ontology, this is represented by ff:incomeTaxLiability with the value ff:UnlimitedTaxLiability. So, I'll add a property constraint for ff:incomeTaxLiability with a value set containing ff:UnlimitedTaxLiability.

2. Alternatively, the user could be a citizen of EU, EWR, or Switzerland. The ontology has ff:isNationalOf, but I need to check if there's a class for these countries. The ontology has ff:EEAplusCH, which includes EEA and Switzerland. So, I can create a class for these countries and set an OR condition for either unlimited tax liability or being a national of an EEAplusCH country.

Wait, but the user could also be an EU citizen without necessarily being a national. Maybe it's better to model this as a union, but since the text says "Staatangehörige der EU, des EWR oder der Schweiz", which translates to nationals, I think using ff:isNationalOf is correct.

Additionally, for EU citizens moving to Germany after August 2019, they must meet certain conditions. This includes being self-employed, employed, job-seeking, deriving rights from a family member, having sufficient means and health insurance, or having permanent residence. These are a bit complex and might involve multiple properties. However, some of these conditions are discretionary or based on third-party assessments, which I should avoid modeling according to the rules. So, I might not include these as they can't be clearly assessed.

Next, the user could have a valid settlement permit or another residence title that allows employment, or be a recognized refugee or entitled to asylum. In the ontology, ff:hasResidencePermit can be used, and I can check if the permit allows employment with ff:entitlesToEmployment. Alternatively, ff:recognizedRefugee or ff:entitledToAsylum are data properties that can be set to true.

So, I'll create a property constraint for ff:incomeTaxLiability and then an OR condition for either being a national of EEAplusCH, having a valid residence permit that allows employment, or being a recognized refugee or entitled to asylum.

For the child:

The child must reside in Germany, another EU country, EWR, or Switzerland. The ontology has ff:countryOfResidence, and I can use ff:EEAplusCH again. So, I'll create a property constraint where the child's country of residence is part of ff:EEAplusCH.

Additionally, if the child lives in the EU/EWR/Switzerland but the parent is taxed in Germany, there's an alternative condition. This might be more complex, but perhaps it's sufficient to just check the child's residence.

Putting it all together, I'll structure the SHACL graph with the necessary property constraints and logical ORs where applicable.

I need to make sure all terms are from the ontology and that the SHACL is syntactically correct. I'll use only Core components, so no advanced features. I'll serialize it in Turtle and enclose it within triple backticks.

```turtle
@prefix ff: <https://foerderfunke.org/default#> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .

ff:UserShape
  a sh:Shape ;
  sh:targetClass ff:User ;
  sh:property [
      sh:path ff:incomeTaxLiability ;

  sh:property [
      sh:path ff:isNationalOf ;
      sh:in (
        ff:EEAplusCH
      ) ;

  sh:property [

      sh:in (
        ff:ResidencePermit
      ) ;

  sh:property [

      sh:hasValue "true" ;

  sh:property [
      sh:path ff:recognizedRefugee ;
      sh:hasValue "true" ;

  sh:property [
      sh:path ff:entitledToAsylum ;
      sh:hasValue "true" ;
    ] ;
  sh:property [
      sh:path ff:countryOfResidence ;
      sh:in (
        ff:EEAplusCH
      ) ;
    ] .

rendered_prompt:
Your task is to generate a validation graph using the Shapes Constraint Language (SHACL) based on the description of eligibility requirements for a social benefit. The SHACL graph will be used to validate RDF user data to determine if they are eligible for the benefit. It must therefore always target the node "ff:User".

You will receive:
    - Ontology: Defines the classes, properties, and individuals used in the user RDF graphs.
    - Text: The social benefit description that you must transform into a SHACL graph.

Strictly comply to the following rules:
    - Ensure the output is syntactically valid SHACL.
    - Use only SHACL Core constraint components. 
    - Do not model requirements that cannot be clearly assessed because they are ambiguous or at the discretion of third parties.
    - Do not invent terms outside the ontology.
    - Serialize the shapes graph in Turtle syntax and enclose it within triple backticks, like this: ```turtle ...Turtle content... ```

Text:

Es folgen die Bedingungen für die Sozialleistung 'Ausbildungsgeld' mit der IDLB B100019_LB_574711.
  * Sie haben eine Behinderung und Ihr zuständiger Rehabilitationsträger ist die Bundesagentur für Arbeit.
  * Sie werden an einer der folgenden Maßnahmen teilnehmen: 
    * (erste) berufliche Ausbildung,
    * berufsvorbereitende Bildungsmaßnahme einschließlich einer Grundausbildung,
    * individuelle betriebliche Qualifizierung im Rahmen der Unterstützten Beschäftigung,
    * Eingangsverfahren oder Berufsbildungsbereich in einer Werkstatt für behinderte Menschen oder bei einem anderen Leistungsanbieter.
  * Sie haben keinen Anspruch auf Übergangsgeld.

SHACL:
raw_response:
<think>
Okay, so I need to create a SHACL graph based on the eligibility requirements for the social benefit 'Ausbildungsgeld' with the IDLB B100019_LB_574711. The target is always the node "ff:User". 

First, I'll look at the conditions provided:

1. The user has a disability and their responsible rehabilitation provider is the Federal Employment Agency (Bundesagentur für Arbeit).
2. The user is participating in one of the specified training measures.
3. The user has no claim to transition allowance (Übergangsgeld).

Now, I'll break down each condition and map it to the ontology.

Starting with the first condition: The user has a disability. In the ontology, there's a data property ff:hasDisability with range xsd:boolean. So, I'll set a constraint that ff:hasDisability must be true.

Next, the responsible rehabilitation provider is the Federal Employment Agency. The ontology has an object property ff:hasRehabilitationProvider with range ff:RehabilitationProvider. The individual ff:FederalEmploymentAgency is an instance of ff:RehabilitationProvider. So, I'll create a constraint that the user's rehabilitation provider must be ff:FederalEmploymentAgency.

Moving to the second condition: The user participates in one of the listed training measures. The ontology has an object property ff:participates with range ff:Training. The measures mentioned correspond to different types of training. I'll use the property ff:participates and set the allowed values to the specific training types. However, looking at the ontology, I see that ff:EntryProcedureAndVocationalTrainingArea is a subclass of ff:Training. So, I can use this class to represent the specific measure. I'll create a constraint that the user must participate in an instance of ff:EntryProcedureAndVocationalTrainingArea.

The third condition is that the user has no claim to transition allowance. The ontology has an object property ff:isIneligibleFor with range ff:SocialBenefit. The individual ff:B100019_LB_102716305 represents the transition allowance. So, I'll set a constraint that the user is ineligible for this benefit.

Putting it all together, I'll structure each condition as a separate shape within the SHACL graph, ensuring each constraint is properly defined and targets the ff:User node. I'll also make sure to use the correct prefixes and syntax in Turtle format.

I should also ensure that I don't invent any new terms and only use the provided ontology. Each constraint must be clear and unambiguous, avoiding any discretionary assessments. I'll double-check each property and class to confirm they exist in the ontology and correctly represent the conditions.

Finally, I'll serialize the SHACL graph in Turtle syntax, making sure it's syntactically valid and properly formatted within triple backticks as specified.
</think>

```turtle
@prefix ff: <https://foerderfunke.org/default#> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .

ff:User
  a sh:Shape ;
  sh:property [
    sh:path ff:hasDisability ;
    sh:datatype xsd:boolean ;
    sh:minCount 1 ;
    sh:maxCount 1 ;
    sh:equals true ;
  ] , [
    sh:path ff:hasRehabilitationProvider ;
    sh:class ff:RehabilitationProvider ;
    sh:equals ff:FederalEmploymentAgency ;
  ] , [
    sh:path ff:participates ;
    sh:class ff:EntryProcedureAndVocationalTrainingArea ;
  ] , [
    sh:path ff:isIneligibleFor ;
    sh:class ff:SocialBenefit ;
    sh:equals ff:B100019_LB_102716305 ;
  ] .
```

rendered_prompt:
Your task is to generate a validation graph using the Shapes Constraint Language (SHACL) based on the description of eligibility requirements for a social benefit. The SHACL graph will be used to validate RDF user data to determine if they are eligible for the benefit. It must therefore always target the node "ff:User".

You will receive:
    - Ontology: Defines the classes, properties, and individuals used in the user RDF graphs.
    - Text: The social benefit description that you must transform into a SHACL graph.

Strictly comply to the following rules:
    - Ensure the output is syntactically valid SHACL.
    - Use only SHACL Core constraint components. 
    - Do not model requirements that cannot be clearly assessed because they are ambiguous or at the discretion of third parties.
    - Do not invent terms outside the ontology.
    - Serialize the shapes graph in Turtle syntax and enclose it within triple backticks, like this: ```turtle ...Turtle content... ```

Text:

Es folgen die Bedingungen für die Sozialleistung 'Arbeitslosengeld' mit der IDLB B100019_LB_576842.
Sie haben Anspruch auf Arbeitslosengeld, wenn

  * Sie arbeitslos sind, das heißt,
    * Sie stehen nicht in einem Beschäftigungsverhältnis oder
    * Sie üben nur eine Erwerbstätigkeit in einem Umfang von weniger als 15 Stunden wöchentlich aus und
    * Sie stehen den Vermittlungsbemühungen der Agentur für Arbeit zur Verfügung. Sie sind also in der Lage und bereit, eine versicherungspflichtige Beschäftigung unter arbeitsmarktüblichen Bedingungen aufzunehmen;
  * Sie sich 
    * elektronisch mit einem elektronischen Identitätsnachweis, zum Beispiel Personalausweis mit Online-Ausweisfunktion, im eServices-Portal der Bundesagentur für Arbeit oder
    * persönlich bei der zuständigen Agentur für Arbeit arbeitslos gemeldet haben. Mit Ihrer persönlichen Arbeitslosmeldung gilt das Arbeitslosengeld als beantragt. Zusätzlich muss noch ein Antragsformular ausgefüllt werden;
  * Sie innerhalb der letzten 30 Monate vor der Arbeitslosmeldung (der sogenannten Rahmenfrist) mindestens 12 Monate versicherungspflichtig waren. 
    * Es werden auch Zeiten berücksichtigt, in denen Sie wegen des Bezuges von Entgeltersatzleistungen, wie zum Beispiel Krankengeld, oder - unter weiteren Voraussetzungen - zum Beispiel wegen der Pflege eines Angehörigen oder der Erziehung eines Kindes versicherungspflichtig zur Arbeitsförderung waren.
    * Als Versicherungszeit können auch Zeiten berücksichtigt werden, in denen ein Antragspflichtversicherungsverhältnis (sogenannte freiwillige Weiterversicherung) vorlag, zum Beispiel  weil Sie eine selbständige Tätigkeit aufgenommen haben.
    * In Sonderfällen werden auch Zeiten berücksichtigt, in denen Sie Entwicklungsdienst nach dem Entwicklungshelfergesetz geleistet haben oder Sie auf der Grundlage eines Sekundierungsvertrages im Ausland tätig waren.

raw_response:
<think>
Alright, I need to create a SHACL graph based on the eligibility requirements for "Arbeitslosengeld" (unemployment benefit) with the ID B100019_LB_576842. The target is the node "ff:User", so all constraints will apply to instances of this class.

First, I'll break down the eligibility criteria from the provided text:

1. **Employment Status**: The user must be unemployed. This means they are not in an employment relationship, or if they are, it's for less than 15 hours a week. Additionally, they must be available for the employment agency's placement efforts.

2. **Registration**: The user must have registered as unemployed either electronically with an ID or in person at the employment agency. If done in person, the registration also serves as the application.

3. **Insurance Period**: Within the last 30 months before registration, the user must have been subject to compulsory insurance for at least 12 months. This includes periods where they received benefits like sick pay or were caring for a family member or raising a child. Self-employment periods under voluntary continued insurance and certain foreign service times also count.

Now, I'll map these criteria to the SHACL constraints using the provided ontology.

**1. Employment Status**:
- **ff:inEmployment**: This should be false because they shouldn't be in a regular employment relationship.
- **ff:workHoursPerWeek**: If employed, it should be less than 15 hours.
- **ff:availableForPlacement**: Must be true, indicating willingness to take up employment.

**2. Registration**:
- **ff:hasEmploymentStatus**: The user must have a status of "RegisteredUnemployed".

**3. Insurance Period**:
- **ff:compulsoryInsuranceFor12In30**: This data property must be true, indicating the user meets the 12-month requirement within the last 30 months.

I'll structure these constraints into a SHACL shape, ensuring each is properly linked and uses the correct logical connectors. Since SHACL Core doesn't support disjunctions directly, I'll use conjunctions where possible and separate shapes for different conditions.

I also need to ensure that all terms used are from the provided ontology to avoid inventing new ones. Each constraint is clearly defined, avoiding ambiguous requirements. For example, the 12-month insurance period is a clear, verifiable condition.

Finally, I'll serialize the graph in Turtle syntax, making sure it's syntactically valid and enclosed within triple backticks as per the instructions.
</think>

```turtle
@prefix ff: <https://foerderfunke.org/default#> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .

ff:UnemploymentBenefitEligibilityShape a sh:NodeShape ;
    sh:targetClass ff:User ;
    sh:property [
        sh:path ff:inEmployment ;
        sh:minCount 1 ;
        sh:maxCount 1 ;
        sh:equals false ;
    ] , [
        sh:path ff:workHoursPerWeek ;
        sh:minCount 1 ;
        sh:maxCount 1 ;
        sh:lessThan 15 ;
    ] , [
        sh:path ff:availableForPlacement ;
        sh:minCount 1 ;
        sh:maxCount 1 ;
        sh:equals true ;
    ] , [
        sh:path ff:hasEmploymentStatus ;
        sh:minCount 1 ;
        sh:maxCount 1 ;
        sh:equals ff:RegisteredUnemployed ;
    ] , [
        sh:path ff:compulsoryInsuranceFor12In30 ;
        sh:minCount 1 ;
        sh:maxCount 1 ;
        sh:equals true ;
    ] .
```

Your task is to generate a validation graph using the Shapes Constraint Language (SHACL) based on the description of eligibility requirements for a social benefit. The SHACL graph will be used to validate RDF user data to determine if they are eligible for the benefit. It must therefore always target the node "ff:User".

You will receive:
    - Ontology: Defines the classes, properties, and individuals used in the user RDF graphs.
    - Text: The social benefit description that you must transform into a SHACL graph.

Strictly comply to the following rules:
    - Ensure the output is syntactically valid SHACL.
    - Use only SHACL Core constraint components. 
    - Do not model requirements that cannot be clearly assessed because they are ambiguous or at the discretion of third parties.
    - Do not invent terms outside the ontology.
    - Serialize the shapes graph in Turtle syntax and enclose it within triple backticks, like this: ```turtle ...Turtle content... ```

Text:

Es folgen die Bedingungen für die Sozialleistung 'Gesetzliche Unfallversicherung Rentenabfindung' mit der IDLB B100019_LB_102799525.
  * Sie müssen einen Anspruch auf Hinterbliebenenleistung aus der gesetzlichen Unfallversicherung haben.
  * Sie haben wiedergeheiratet oder eine neue Lebenspartnerschaft nach dem Lebenspartnerschaftsgesetz begründet.

But in SHACL, I can model this by checking if the user's marital status is 'Married' or 'CivilUnion' and that they have a deceased spouse or civil partner.

So, for the second condition, I'll use 'hasMaritalStatus' with 'Married' or 'CivilUnion', and also check if they have a deceased spouse or civil partner using 'deceasedSpouse' or 'deceasedCivilPartner'.

Putting it all together, the SHACL graph will target 'ff:User' and include two conditions:

rendered_prompt:
Your task is to generate a validation graph using the Shapes Constraint Language (SHACL) based on the description of eligibility requirements for a social benefit. The SHACL graph will be used to validate RDF user data to determine if they are eligible for the benefit. It must therefore always target the node "ff:User".

You will receive:
    - Ontology: Defines the classes, properties, and individuals used in the user RDF graphs.
    - Text: The social benefit description that you must transform into a SHACL graph.

Strictly comply to the following rules:
    - Ensure the output is syntactically valid SHACL.
    - Use only SHACL Core constraint components. 
    - Do not model requirements that cannot be clearly assessed because they are ambiguous or at the discretion of third parties.
    - Do not invent terms outside the ontology.
    - Serialize the shapes graph in Turtle syntax and enclose it within triple backticks, like this: ```turtle ...Turtle content... ```

Text:

Es folgen die Bedingungen für die Sozialleistung 'Förderung für Maßnahmen zur Aktivierung und beruflichen Eingliederung' mit der IDLB B100019_LB_102730340.
  * Sie erhalten Leistungen der Grundsicherung.
  * Die Notwendigkeit der Unterstützungsleistung wurde im Gespräch mit Ihrer Integrationsfachkraft festgestellt.
  * Die Teilnahme wurde vor Maßnahmebeginn durch das Jobcenter genehmigt.

```turtle
@prefix ff: <https://foerderfunke.org/default#> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .

      sh:predicate ff:needsCare ;
      sh:class ff:CareNeed ;
    ] .
```

rendered_prompt:
Your task is to generate a validation graph using the Shapes Constraint Language (SHACL) based on the description of eligibility requirements for a social benefit. The SHACL graph will be used to validate RDF user data to determine if they are eligible for the benefit. It must therefore always target the node "ff:User".

You will receive:
    - Ontology: Defines the classes, properties, and individuals used in the user RDF graphs.
    - Text: The social benefit description that you must transform into a SHACL graph.

Strictly comply to the following rules:
    - Ensure the output is syntactically valid SHACL.
    - Use only SHACL Core constraint components. 
    - Do not model requirements that cannot be clearly assessed because they are ambiguous or at the discretion of third parties.
    - Do not invent terms outside the ontology.
    - Serialize the shapes graph in Turtle syntax and enclose it within triple backticks, like this: ```turtle ...Turtle content... ```

Text:

Es folgen die Bedingungen für die Sozialleistung 'Grundausbildung für Menschen mit Seh- oder Hörbehinderung' mit der IDLB B100019_LB_102717659.
  * Sie haben eine hochgradige Seh oder Hörbehinderung oder Ihnen droht eine solche Behinderung.
  * Ihr zuständiger Rehabilitationsträger ist die Bundesagentur für Arbeit.
  * Ihre Aussichten am Arbeitsleben teilzuhaben oder wieder teilzuhaben sind wegen Art und Schwere Ihrer Behinderung nicht nur vorübergehend wesentlich gemindert und Sie brauchen deshalb Hilfen zur Teilhabe am Arbeitsleben.
  * Sie sind bereit, sich beruflich bilden oder auf andere Weise beruflich eingliedern zu lassen.

SHACL:
raw_response:
<think>
Alright, I need to create a SHACL graph based on the given eligibility criteria for the social benefit 'Grundausbildung für Menschen mit Seh- oder Hörbehinderung'. The target is the node "ff:User", so all constraints should apply to instances of this class.

First, I'll break down the text into individual requirements:

1. **High-degree visual or hearing impairment or at risk of such impairment.**
   - This translates to checking if the user has a severe disability (ff:severeDisability) and whether it's a visual or hearing impairment. Since the ontology has ff:VisualImpairment and ff:HearingImpairment as subclasses of ff:Disability, I can use these. Alternatively, using ff:hasDisabilityType with these specific types would also work.

2. **The responsible rehabilitation provider is the Federal Employment Agency (Bundesagentur für Arbeit).**
   - The user must have a rehabilitation provider (ff:hasRehabilitationProvider) set to ff:FederalEmploymentAgency.

3. **Prospects for participating in working life are significantly reduced due to the nature and severity of the disability, and assistance is needed.**
   - This implies that the disability reduces work prospects permanently (ff:reducesWorkProspectsPermanently) and that the user is unfit for work (ff:unfitForWork). Alternatively, checking if the earning capacity is reduced (ff:unfitForWork might be a data property under ff:EarningCapacity).

4. **Willingness to undergo vocational training or integration.**
   - The user must be willing to participate in training, which can be represented by ff:availableForPlacement being true.

Now, considering the SHACL constraints:

- **Property Constraints:** For each property, I'll define a sh:property and specify the constraints using sh:hasValue, sh:minCount, or other components.

- **Class Constraints:** Ensure that the user is an instance of ff:User, but since the shape targets this node, it's implicit.

I need to use only SHACL Core components, so I'll avoid advanced features. Each condition will be a separate shape or part of a shape.

I also need to ensure that the ontology terms are used correctly. For example, ff:hasDisabilityType links to ff:Disability, and since ff:VisualImpairment and ff:HearingImpairment are subclasses, using them as objects makes sense.

Putting it all together, I'll create a shape for ff:User with each constraint as a property. Each property will have the appropriate value or condition. I'll make sure the Turtle syntax is correct, using prefixes and proper structure.
</think>

```turtle
@prefix ff: <https://foerderfunke.org/default#> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .

ff:UserShape
  a sh:NodeShape ;
  sh:targetClass ff:User ;
  sh:property [
    sh:path ff:hasDisabilityType ;
    sh:hasValue ff:VisualImpairment, ff:HearingImpairment ;
    sh:minCount 1 ;
  ] ,
  [
    sh:path ff:hasRehabilitationProvider ;
    sh:hasValue ff:FederalEmploymentAgency ;
  ] ,
  [
    sh:path ff:reducesWorkProspectsPermanently ;
    sh:hasValue "true"^^xsd:boolean ;
  ] ,
  [
    sh:path ff:availableForPlacement ;
    sh:hasValue "true"^^xsd:boolean ;
  ] .
```

rendered_prompt:
Your task is to generate a validation graph using the Shapes Constraint Language (SHACL) based on the description of eligibility requirements for a social benefit. The SHACL graph will be used to validate RDF user data to determine if they are eligible for the benefit. It must therefore always target the node "ff:User".

You will receive:
    - Ontology: Defines the classes, properties, and individuals used in the user RDF graphs.
    - Text: The social benefit description that you must transform into a SHACL graph.

Strictly comply to the following rules:
    - Ensure the output is syntactically valid SHACL.
    - Use only SHACL Core constraint components. 
    - Do not model requirements that cannot be clearly assessed because they are ambiguous or at the discretion of third parties.
    - Do not invent terms outside the ontology.
    - Serialize the shapes graph in Turtle syntax and enclose it within triple backticks, like this: ```turtle ...Turtle content... ```
